channel.title: Domain Names
channel.description: Ok, say I don't want to buy a domain from a registrar. (I don't care about the money, I'd rather just do it this way) How does a domain work? I know how DNS interprets the domain into an IP but say I wanted my own domain on my own server, without having to register it anywhere else? Is there any way of doing this? Thank you, and sorry for the noob question. :P

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @x_m4gickz_x x m4gickz x
item.description:
@x_m4gickz_x wrote:

Tyder:

i want to make a own server… can any1 help my? plz help

wrong forums!

Read full topic

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“parad0x_, post:21, topic:27161”]Yes I know.
I’m not trying to do that anymore I’m just wondering…
HOW. DO. THEY. DO. IT.
I don’t want to anymore, I’m just wanting to know how they do it lol
Thanks again… :rolleyes:[/quote]

They sign up with a main register company, and then they have to pay per month or year. They need to invest a lot on the business.

No problem,
Leader

Read full topic

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

Yes I know.
I’m not trying to do that anymore I’m just wondering…

I don’t want to anymore, I’m just wanting to know how they do it lol

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

As I told you before, you cannot do it. If you wanted to provide people with domains, you would have to pay a set fee per domain per month or year. Just buy a domain from a domain register such as Godaddy, Yahoo, or Ipower.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“parad0x_, post:17, topic:27161”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=40445.msg494555#msg494555 date=1164081562]
Yeah that is pretty bad ram for a server, and that computer is so not worth 500 dollars. I built a better computer then that last year for 400 dollars(Canadian, so thats 300 and something in USD).

But yeah I was reading, I’m pretty sure you’ll just ahve to register your domain from a registrar.
[/quote]
Do you have any idea how they do it?
Thanks again. =)[/quote]
Not quite sure, but I’m pretty sure ICANN(internet corporation for assigned names and numbers) has a lot to do with it. http://www.icann.org/

But I’m in the same boat as you. I know hardly anything about how a registrar sets up a domain. Try looking up on become your own domain registrar.

Read full topic

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:6, topic:27161”][quote author=parad0x_ link=topic=40445.msg491515#msg491515 date=1164022003]
Yea…but how do I run my own domain name from my house?
Not from Yahoo! or Verio etc.
I want to have my own domain.
How does Yahoo! make the domains and could I do it?
Thanks for your input.
[/quote]

You cannot do it. There is no way that you can get the domain free unless you go onto a site that requires points for a free domain name. Just buy a domain, you still own it. It is your domain, no one else can have it or take it away.[/quote]

Yea I already knew everything you told me, just wondering how the registrars do it.
Thanks though…

Read full topic

item.title: Domain Names
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

[quote=“parad0x_, post:5, topic:27161”]Yea…but how do I run my own domain name from my house?
Not from Yahoo! or Verio etc.
I want to have my own domain.
How does Yahoo! make the domains and could I do it?
Thanks for your input.[/quote]

You cannot do it. There is no way that you can get the domain free unless you go onto a site that requires points for a free domain name. Just buy a domain, you still own it. It is your domain, no one else can have it or take it away.

Read full topic
